clues.text: "A Remarkable Woman", about this late actress, says she saw Spencer Tracy in "Captains Courageous" 52 times

After this book was released in 1997, Mineko Iwasaki, on whom it was based, sued for defamation
She said her "The Handmaid's Tale" is about taking casual attitudes toward women to their logical conclusions
Marjane Satrapi's heroine in this graphic novel has to deal with the overthrow of the shah
The Chesapeake colonies consisted of Virginia & this one
The founder of this colony called it a "holy experiment" where Quaker beliefs could be applied to government
In 1665 New Haven colony merged with this colony
This colony was founded as a buffer area to protect the Carolinas from the Spanish in Florida
The original deed granted to Carteret & Berkeley for this colony called it Nova Caesarea

clues.text: The 4 months of exactly 30 days each; remember the rhyme!
In this sport the number 30 represents the second point scored in a game by 1 player
According to the Constitution, 30 is the minimum age to serve in this congressional body
The King James Bible recounts Judas Iscariot's betrayal of Jesus for this payoff
The 30 Years' War bloodied Europe in this century

clues.text: To push a product, or to advance a subordinate in military rank
Basketball's 3-point line is known as this, the distance around a 2-dimensional shape
To take a risk is to do this to "fate"
A thick Louisiana seafood soup, y'all
11-letter word for a formal dinner at which a person's virtues are spoken of
Known for his Gettysburg "Charge", after the War he sold insurance in Richmond
It was at a victory that this CSA Gen. reportedly said, "It is well that war is so terrible, or we should grow too fond of it"
Julia Ward Howe wrote this "Hymn", the semi-official song of the Union Army, after visiting an army camp near Washington, D.C.
After the War, this Union general known for his whiskers was elected Governor of Rhode Island 3 times
A former slave, she was appointed to the National Freedman's Relief Association in 1864; in your face, Tubman!
Call them "Tovarisch", Russian for this word meaning a friend & fellow Communist
Let your pal Alex become one of these, a sponsor for your kid at his baptism
Assist your bud with this alliterative offering, also the name of Hamburger Helper's mascot
Invite your amigo to Mexico City for your daughter's 15th birthday fiesta, called by this Spanish word
Even though you're a bookie, let pals slide on this, the percentage they owe you when they lose a bet
The Postal Service suggests putting this word on that package of glass unicorn figurines
Characterized by meddlesome curiosity, perhaps like the Charles Schulz dog of the same name
Ladies, according to the title of a 1963 book, you have this type of mystique
Adjective for bad behavior found in "Santa Claus Is Coming To Town"
Cheerful, or tending to float in a fluid
In 1993 KLAX-FM became the first station in this language to top L.A.'s radio ratings
Pennsylvania Dutch is actually a form of this language
This traditional dialect of U.S. Chinatowns is largely being replaced by Mandarin
Oy!  U.S. home speakers of this language dropped by 50% between 1980 & 2010, to around 150,000
Geonbae!  U.S. home speakers of this language quadrupled between 1980 & 2010, to around 1.1 million
This unit of weight for a gemstone is exactly 200 milligrams
This measure of land area was originally as much as a yoke of oxen could plow in a day
This ancient measure found in the Bible ranged between 18 & 22 inches
For liquids, 4 cups equals 2 pints or one of these units
This measure of computer speed equals 1 trillion (with a "T") floating-point operations per second
British scholar Roger Ascham's "Schoolmaster" shows how to teach writing in this language
With knee-slappers like "Is she a widow?  I love her better therefore", "Ralph Roister Doister" is the oldest English one
John Skelton's satire "Collyn Clout" was directed against this cardinal & adviser to Henry VIII
This Edmund Spenser work is named for Gloriana, who had several knights in her service
The educated playwrights known as the "University Wits" included this author of "Tamburlaine the Great"

rounds.text: Poet & translator Anne Carson addresses her: "Your name in Greek means something like 'against birth'"
